story:
Short Summary

My Name is Afrikanus Kofi Akosah, I'm the President of Africa Youth Peace Call, an organisation dedicated to the study and advancement of classical liberalism (libertarianism) and lassaiz-faire capitalism (free enterprise) in Africa. We try to change peoples’ ideas, opinions, and mode of thinking by research, seminars and publications. AYPC wants to become the leading organisation in the freedom education of young people in Africa.

Thanks to adherents of Liberty like you, we have been organizing the Liberty & Entrepreneurship Camps for college students & anyone who cares to discover new ideas since 2008. The Week long seminar expose students to the Philosophy of Liberty & Entrepreneurship Skills as the means to wealth creation. Our focus is to prepare participants to start businesses & institutions for policy reforms.

The Goal Post is Shifting! Gradually Africans are beginning to understand the role of individual Freedom & Liberty in ensuring prosperity. Donating towards the Summer Session which is scheduled from 8-13 June, 2014, at the Lake Bosomtwe where we have our Liberty Village will extend the frontiers of Liberty in Africa.

We need $12,000 to provide accommodation, Food, Transport & Learning materials at the Lakeside for 40 students throughout the week. Students are contributing half of the cost with half coming from your kind donations.  Help us Demystify Poverty & Tyranny in Africa. 

Line-up teachers include Prof. Steve Horwitz, Dr. Tom G. Palmer, Prof. Ken Schoolland, Jacob Hornberger, Rui Nobre Pinheiro, Dan Mclaughlin, Lode Cossaer, Chris Lingle, Gregory V. Diehl, Noel Berge, Max Borders, Jeffrey Tucker etc.. Some of them will be at the location whilst others will teach via video conference.
600 friends of Liberty donating $10 each will see us through. Don't forget, if you can't donate you can spread the word. Thank you good people!

story:
Makara Kids Fights Against Skin Cancer With Sun-Safe Swimwear.

Made In Canada. 

A percent of all contributions will go to the Canadian Skin Cancer Foundation, in support of their Go Safe, sun safety education programme. 

ABOUT US

Everyone knows someone who has been affected by Skin Cancer, and it's something that can be prevented. Makara Kids is committed to spreading the word to parents about the importance of sun protection for their children. At Makara, we understand that protecting our children is a top priority and that’s why we are so proud of our first collection as it offers parents the option to fashionably protect their children from the harmful environmental effects present in our modern world. 

Our passion for fashion and love for the outdoors drove us to create the bet possible sun-safe swimwear for children. Becoming a social entrepreneur isn't just exciting, It provides new possibilities to change people's lives. At Makara, we believe in good fashionable design for our kids and we believe good design is honest. We strive for excellence, but never at the cost of even one life. We believe in family, hope and love. 

Makara Kids is proudly designed and manufactured in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.

SUN PROTECTION

Taking measures to protect your family from the sun will help to prevent the long term consequences of overexposure, such as skin cancer, or the short-term effects such as sunburn.  It is extremely important to protect children and babies from the sun as they are not born with the developed skin protection system found in adults. Overexposure to the sun can begin in childhood and last a lifetime. All Makara Kids swimwear is UPF 50+, blocking up to 98 % of UV rays. 

For more information on skin cancer and the importance of sun protection please visit: http://www.canadianskincancerfoundation.com , http://www.dermatology.ca . 

OUR SWIMWEAR

                         

The Makara Kids swimwear collection is made exclusively from Ultraviolet Protection Factor (UPF) 50+ protective nylon spandex. All swimwear designs provide maximum coverage from wrist to ankle and include an innovative hood, offering complete sun coverage.  

Our swimwear collection uses two top quality fabrics, a High Performance Nylon-Spandex Tricot and a Poly – Spandex Tricot, which is great for sublimation and heat transfer printing.  Both fabrics are UPF 50 + and are free of harsh chemical treatments. 

We believe these are bathing suits both you and your children will love.

PERKS

Baby Hooded Swim Onsie $65 - UPF 50+, zipper closure, sizes 3-24 months. Girls: Mini Parrot with Orchid and Teal colour blocking. Boys: Mini Parrot and Hand Drawn stripe.


Girls Hooded Peplum swim top $65 - UPF 50+, zipper detail, sizes 2/3, 3/4, 4/5, 5/6 years. Shown in Mini Parrot *also available in Feather. Girls Swim brief $20 - UPF 50+, sizes 2/3, 3/4 4/5, 5/6 years. Shown in Orchid *also available in Teal.


Girls Rouched side swim top $45 - UPF 50+, sizes 2/3, 3/4, 4/5, 5/6 years. Shown in Feather *also available in Mini Parrot. Unisex Swim leggings $35 - UPF 50+, sizes 2/3, 3/4, 4/5, 5/6 years. Shown in Mini Parrot *also available in Hand Drawn stripe, Teal and Orchid. 


Boys Hooded swim top $45 - UPF 50+, zipper detail, sizes 2/3, 3/4, 4/5, 5/6 years. Shown in Hand Drawn stripe *also available in Teal. Boys Swim Short $40 - UPF 50+, sizes 2/3, 3/4, 4/5, 5/6 years. City Scape

We Need Your Support!

Thank you for checking out our IndieGogo page. We truly appreciate all the support. By purchasing one of our awesome swimsuits and contributing to our campaign, you are helping us to bring this important collection to production.  But that's not the only way to help, by sharing our story with a friend you are helping us reach others. If you could do something as simple as tweeting about our page, or liking us on Facebook, it could really go a long way. We are doing everything we can to spread the word of our campaign, and the message of the importance of sun protection for children. We thank you for doing the same, and helping make our dream a reality.

*Remember making a contribution means you are pre-purchasing our awesome swimwear, the estimated delivery of your order is May 30th. Without your contribution Makara kids would not be possible! 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $8,500.00 as our suppliers and manufacturers have minimum orders in place and we need to pre-sell enough bathing suits to fufill these minimums to bring our collection to production.

We dream of creating a full line of innovative activewear, starting with style updates to our current collection, and we want to make it  available through an e-commerce store @ www.makarakids.com . In addition to creating a recognized children's activewear brand, we want to use this campaign and our website as a tool to inform parents and there children about the importance of sun protection. So join with us on this journey and be apart of it every step of the way. 

We will send out several updates throughout the entire process making sure our backers are up-to-date on any important information. Please remember to check your junk mail and inbox regulary after your purchase, as we will be sending out an email to determine the SIZE and COLOUR of your particular order. If you have any questions or concerns please contact us at info@makarakids.com  

Once The Campaign Closes, How Will You Fulfill The Orders?

Once our campaign closes, we will order our fabric and begin production.  Production time takes roughly 30 days once fabric has arrived at the manufacturer, depending on the quantity of the order.  Our team will then ship the orders to our awesome backers! We will ship Via Canada Post for all domestic orders which should make for a very smooth process. 

Risks And Challenges.

Getting the word out and convincing the IndieGogo community to participate will be our biggest challenge. With so many great projects to choose from, we hope ours will stand apart from the rest. To reach as many people as possible, we are asking friends, families, and various blogs to help spread the word.

Once the funding is in place, our next challenge will be producing on a large scale. However,  we have confidence in our manufacturer of the past several months to help us with any issues we have along the way.

story:
PIGLT NEEDS YOUR HELP TO MAKE THE FINANCING OF EDUCATION AN ENTREPRENEURIAL EXPERIENCE!

Piglt (pronounced ‘piglet’) --  http://www.PIGLT.com -- is “Education’s Entrepreneurial Piggy Bank."  No one should be discouraged from pursuing an education (and ultimately what they are passionate about) due to burdensome tuition costs and student loan debt. Piglt changes the way individuals and organizations (like non-profits) pay for or fundraise for education.  But we need your help to do that!  

What the Funds Raised on IndieGoGo Will Be Used For:

(1) To Grow our Team:  We need to hire a "Community Manager".  We also need to hire a "Business Development" manager to preach the benefits of Piglt to people and organizations -- help us get the word out!  Finally, we need to hire additional developers to help give our CTO a little bit of a break and to keep perfecting our platform.

(2) To Pay for Operating Expenses:  In addition to hiring key personnel (and creating jobs!), we need help paying for hosting & servers costs, attendance of events/trade shows, etc. 

(3) To Pay for Marketing and PR: We want everyone to know about Piglt!  

Why Should I Contribute to Piglt's Campaign?

Check out the video to see how Piglt is trying to help people improve their lives by funding educations and paying off burdensome student loan debt.


To recap, Piglt is already helping people use their skills to pay for their schooling or pay off their existing student loan debt. (Piglt also can be used by organizations to fundraise for education -- more on that below!

Piglt has two users:


"Dreamers" = Fundraisers

and

"Believers" = Funders


Dreamers offer incentives like skills or products (like t-shirts, original artwork, etc.) they’ve created in exchange for financial contributions from the community (friends, family, alumni, etc.).

Believers who are inspired by the Dreamers' campaign or incentive help the Dreamer pay their student loans (private or otherwise) or tuition.  

**Those financial contributions are sent directly to the school or the Organization, ensuring that all funds raised are actually used for their intended purpose.**

Piglt is different!!  Piglt does not obligate Dreamers to additional debt (in the form of lower-interest alternative loans) or to promise a percentage of their future income to investors. 

“It’s counterproductive and ultimately not student-friendly to indenture the Dreamers to further debt and financial uncertainty; there's a reason they are actively seeking financial assistance in the first place. They [the Dreamers] have already spent good money on their education and training and they should be empowered to use those skills to further their careers and better their lives,” says Co-Founder Casey Wallace. 

Piglt is already successful, but needs your help to keep up the good work!

PIGLT HELPED PAY HER TUITION!

Is Piglt just for individual students?  No!

Piglt is not just for individuals.  Organizations / Non-profits can also use Piglt to highlight the individuals they're impacting and the projects that make their organization unique to effectively and easily raise money.  Anyone with an education-related cause can use Piglt to easily and effectively raise money. 

“There are so many wonderful educational organizations that are unfortunately very underfunded, lack alumni participation, and generally need help raising addition money. We’ve created the perfect solution to help anyone fundraise, build a lasting support community, and improve the lives of people everywhere,” says Co-Founder Vidya Chokkalingam.

Is that all?  Nope!

Believers can also proactively create their own "Piglt Fund" (like a scholarship) for qualified Dreamers.  Not only can Believers use Piglt Funds to support certain types of students (say, fellow alumni with similar interests), Believers can also use Piglt Funds to find (and perhaps eventually hire!) people with specific skills, all the while helping those people to pay off their education-debt. 

In addition to helping Dreamers fund their higher education, Piglt’s hope is that the short-term exchange of services between Dreamers and Believers will lead to long-term employment or ongoing professional relationships.


Piglt is already getting some love!

Piglt was recently featured in Venture Beat

"Piglt’s goal is to try and minimize the debt as much as possible through creative, alternative forms of financing." - Rebecca Grant, Venture Beat 


As well as in PandoDaily, started by Sarah Lacy, formerly of TechCrunch. 

“Piglt is unique in its desire to create longer term relationships between financiers and those seeking backing. If anything, the model seems to be the most scalable and attractive from a societal good point of view.” - Pando Daily's Michael Carney


and The San Francisco Chronicle!


About the founders:


Piglt was co-founded by its CEO Casey Wallace and CTO Vidya Chokkalingam. 

Casey is a graduate of the US Air Force Academy -- meaning that he completed his undergraduate education debt-free by serving in the military after graduation. But when he married a lawyer with enough student loan debt for the both of them, he started trying to figure out a better way to pay for education. He wanted to create an entrepreneurial environment where anyone could use their existing skills and training to pay off their educational debt and pave the way for their future. Wallace has an MBA from Loyola Marymount University.

Vidya is a graduate of Guindy Anna University’s College of Engineering and also obtained her MBA in Finance & Entrepreneurship from Loyola Marymount University. Vidya has over 5 years of experience in education and technology development and is extremely involved in the start-up community in India.


Our Mascot, Finley -- the Irish Doodle!

(she's an Irish Setter & Standard Poodle mix)



Piglt is the best and easiest way to raise money for present or past education, network with members from your alma mater, find qualified candidates with specific skills, or fundraise for your organization or nonprofit. 

Piglt can be the answer to help solving the student debt crisis-- but we need help!


If I contribute, what can I get from you?


In addition to the satisfaction of helping get this awesome cause off to the races, we are offering the following incentives.


Incentives:



'I <3 Piglt' Sticker


Recycled Cardboard Piglt Piggy Bank (example only pictured)


 The Piglt Pad (size 5" X 8")

story:
Hi, Bonjour, Marhaba! 

I'm a graduate from the School of Oriental and African Studies (London) where I completed a Masters in the field of Middle Eastern studies last year, and I'm trying to raise money for the next important stage in my life: to master Arabic! 

I recently applied to one of the most reputable Arabic programs abroad I'd heard of - the competitive 10-month Arabic course in Beirut, Lebanon at the IFPO (Institut Francais du Proche-Orient or 'French Institute of the Middle East'). During the rigorous selection process, I had to take an entry exam testing my Arabic skills, and I had to demonstrate that I will pursue a relevant research or work project upon completing their course. And to my great delight, my application was accepted! 

I'm really excited about taking up this unique opportunity - however, the tuition is beyond my means ($5,600), and I need to fundraise! 

This chance to go to Beirut means a lot to me - I studied Arabic at university and acquired the fundamentals, and now I'm at the stage where I would really benefit from a long-term language and cultural immersion in the Arab world.  Mastering Arabic would enable me to pursue a PhD next year during which I want to focus on human rights in the Middle East, and then go into the field of peace-building and international development.  

I'm hoping to raise the tuition in time for the program's start date, October 11th, and I'll be thoroughly grateful for your contributions to this significant step towards my goals ! 

As a token of my appreciation, I am preparing various personalised gifts to send to donators! Check on the right-hand column for details. 

Little by little I can reach my target, so absolutely ANY amount is valued :) 

يد واحدة ماتسقفش  

Or 'one hand on its own cannot clap' - that is, great accomplishments are not done singlehandedly!

story:
We need to talk about the future of meat

The earth’s population is predicted to reach nine billion people by 2050 – and a lot of those people will want to eat meat. It’s no secret, however, that the global meat industry is wasteful, polluting and a major source of greenhouse gases. How can we solve the world’s protein crisis? While it’s possible everyone might switch to insects or tofu, there’s a brand new player on the horizon: lab-grown meat.  

You might remember in vitro meat from the world's first lab-grown hamburger that was presented in August. This technology may soon allow us to produce eco-friendly, animal-friendly meat on a commercial scale, using far fewer resources than “conventional” meat.  

Despite its obvious benefits, many people are still uncomfortable with the idea of in vitro meat. Some even call it unnatural or disgusting. And rightly so. Because before we can decide if we ever want to eat lab-grown meat, we need to explore how it might change our society and everyday lives. 

The future of meat, now in cookbook form!

Using the format of the cookbook as a storytelling medium, the In Vitro Meat Cookbook is a visually stunning exploration of the new “food cultures” lab-grown meat might create. This book approaches lab-grown meat not just from a design and engineering perspective, but also from a societal and ethical one. What will holiday dinners look like if in vitro meat replaces turkey? Would you eat meat grown from your own stem cells? Is lab-grown meat kosher? Or vegetarian?    

This cookbook features dozens of recipes that are delicious, uncanny, funny and inspiring. Think of meat paint, revived dodo wings, meat ice cream, cannibal snacks, steaks knitted like scarves and see-through sushi grown under perfectly controlled conditions. Though you can’t cook these recipes just yet, they’ve all been developed with strict culinary rigor to have correct ingredients and cooking techniques.

The delightful and weird recipes are complimented by fascinating interviews and thought-provoking essays from scientists, activists, philosophers and chefs. Our network of experts will ensure that the cookbook is as scientifically accurate as possible, all while remaining lively and highly approachable for a general audience. 

The In Vitro Meat Cookbook is just at home with your art, philosophy and science books as it is on your cookbook shelf. As the ultimate conversation starter about the future of food, it will redefine not just how you think about lab-grown meat, but how you think about the ways we produce meat right now. Rather than pushing an agenda, this book aims to inspire educated debate. 

The In Vitro Meat Cookbook is divided into four chapters: 

  • Feed the World discusses the ways in which lab-grown meat could address world hunger.
  • Sustainability outlines the eco-friendly credentials of in vitro meat – and the ways it might not be as sustainable as we think.
  • Stop Animal Cruelty talks about the cultural, moral and religious ramifications of a world where animals don’t need to die for meat.
  • Explore New Food Cultures presents truly wild visions of in vitro meals. It’s molecular gastronomy on meat-flavored steroids.

We're fascinated by in vitro meat...

Next Nature, the group behind the In Vitro Meat Cookbook, has been exploring in vitro meat for over two years. Many of the book’s speculative recipes come from the Next Nature Lab at Eindhoven Technical University, one of the best design schools in the Netherlands. We've also produced a dedicated in vitro meat exhibition, currently on view at the Rotterdam World Food Festival. Not content with a book, lab and exhibition, we even made a special “in vitro meat ice cream cart”, with actual, edible ice cream flavored with bacon, beef and (pretend) polar bear.

...but we're still undecided about it.

Just because we're in vitro meat experts doesn’t mean we think it’s the only (or even the best) solution to the global protein crisis. We’re not starry-eyed activists, nor are we bound to the meat industry’s agenda. Just like you, we want to make informed decisions about which meat future we actually want.

What will the cookbook look like? 

The book's design refers to the old-fashioned cooking bibles your grandma might have owned, combined with contemporary typography and photography. The effect is a timeless design that fits with the speculative nature of the book. The involvement of renowned art director Hendrik-Jan Grievink will guarantee an top-notch result.

EXQUISITE DRAWINGS OF THE DISHES

Illustrator Silvia Celiberti has created unique BIC pen drawings to visualize the book's recipes and products. Besides these extraordinarily detailed drawings, the book will also contain a full color section with lush photography and renderings. 

Example Dishes

Magic Meatballs
Magic Meatballs are designed to playfully familiarize children with lab-grown meat. Young people are more prone to overconsumption of proteins and fats, and are more sensitive to the hormones and antibiotics used in conventional meat production. Luckily, lab-grown Magic Meatballs can be tailored precisely to a child’s individual needs. The basic meat consists solely of animal protein, and the combination of fats, omega-3s and vitamins is completely customizable. Colors and flavors can also be added to the neutral base to make the meat change color or crackle in your mouth. Magic Meatballs actively involve kids with the meat they eat, so that future generations will more readily accept protein grown in labs.

Meat Power
The number one argument for eating meat: it provides nutritious proteins that cannot be entirely supplied by vegetarian alternatives. Like it or not, humans are omnivores. Meat is a nutritious source of proteins and vitamins that vegetarian alternatives struggle to supply. Thanks to Meat Powder, we can transcend our barbaric impulses and history of animal cruelty. Meat Powder is a straightforward form of in vitro meat that provides the proteins you need – no more, no less. Meat Powder can be used in soups, pies and salads, but is best used in a creamy meat fondue. Like the traditional cheese fondue, the meat fondue is a social dish best served at special occasions. Pure, fun, and 100% victimless.

Kitchen Bioreactor
The Kitchen Meat Incubator does for home cooking what the electronic synthesizer did for the home musician. It provides its users with a set of pre-programmed samples that can be remixed and combined to their liking. Besides the preparation of traditional styles like steak, sausage or meatballs, consumers can bring their own imagination to the meat preparation process. The handy sliders on the device control size, shape and texture. More expensive models of the Kitchen Meat Incubator also come with a wireless link that allows you to download meat recipes from the internet or share them with friends.

Knitted Meat
Rather than growing whole steaks in bio-reactors, Knitted Meat assumes that it is more feasible to create thin threads of protein. Supermarkets sell balls of meat fiber seasoned with various spices and vegetable flavors. New kitchen appliances enable consumers to weave meat according to preset preferences. Texture, taste and tenderness can be controlled to create a personal, multisensory eating experience. Groups of diners can even knit their own sections of a protein scarf, enabling multiple people to share a unique moment.

Meat Flowers
While vegetarian food products typically mimic existing meat products, the meat flower reverses this principle: In vitro technology is used to grow meat in the shape of a flower. The sweet-savory flower amuse is served sushi style and consumed leaf by leaf using chopsticks. Molecular cooking goes figurative.

Meat Fruit
La Pâte Meat Fruit aims to seduce and inspire diners with an entirely new eating experience that balances eating meat and fruit. In vitro technology is used to grow meat structures that precisely mimic those of various existing fruits such as berries, oranges, and mangoes. The result is used to create La Pâte, a sweet-savory amuse-bouche ideal for Michelin-starred restaurants. Besides the joy of fusing fruit and meat into one exclusive hypernatural dining experience, meat-fruit is also a celebration of our unisex culture. In contrast to our prehistoric past where men hunted and women gathered, we now live in a post-masculine, post-feminist society where gender doesn’t matter like before. Meat-fruit exemplifies the perfect blend between male and female.

Paint with Meat!
Meat paint is a food product for children of 5-10 years old. It allows them to prepare their own meat dish in a very creative, fun and safe way: by painting! The meat paint lets children put some extra effort into their meal, which makes the dinner more valuable and meaningful again. By painting their own meal children get more affinity with their food and are therefore more willing to eat it.

Like with a regular painting, the child has different colors to paint with. With this paint the child can make anything he or she wants and create something beautiful. Once the drawing is finished the painting is baked for 15 minutes in the oven. So it’s not just your child’s beautiful creation, it becomes a tasty meat dish too which the entire family can enjoy and eat!

Rustic In Vitro
Many people still find in vitro meat too alien and artificial to put it in their mouths. With the Rustic In Vitro incubator, this outdated perception is about to change. Similar to old-fashioned sausages and hams hung to cure in the butcher’s or at home, Rustic In Vitro is grown in a familiar-looking incubator that reminds us of the good old days. Rustic In-Vitro incubators come in various shapes designed to simulate rabbit, boar or cattle. The more time it has to ripen, the more structure and character the replicating meat cells will develop. Innovative nostalgia ahoy!

Who are we? And what is Next Nature? 

The Next Nature Network is an Amsterdam-based think tank and design laboratory that explores the new forms of nature that humans create. We discuss how technologies like genetic engineering, mobile phones, and intelligent algorithms change the way humans act, think and interact with the environment. 

Next Nature uses “design fiction” to inspire informed debate about new technologies. Our team has extensive experience producing superb books, exhibitions and web-based projects. The NANO Supermarket, which presents speculative nanotech products for our everyday lives, was recently nominated for a Dutch Design Award. Rayfish Footwear, an online hoax about genetically modified stingray shoes, incited an avalanche of media coverage, fan letters and hate mail. Learn more about it this video.    

CORE TEAM Koert van Mensvoort (Creative Director), Hendrik Jan Grievink (Art Director), Allison Guy (Chef and Copywriter), Silvia Celiberti (Illustrator), Jonathon Markowski (Model Designer), Tim Hoogesteger, Mir Wermuth (Production), Arnoud van den Heuvel, (Video Designer), Francesca Barchiesi, Jiwon Kim, Insoo Hwang, Kwen Chen, (Designers), Alessia Andreotti (Publicity).

RECIPE CONTRIBUTORS Aylin Groenewoud, Frank Valkenhoef, Marjolein Kors, Mark Kanters, Alberto Gruarin, Daniel Ong, Daniëlle Peverelli, Ilse Maessen, Costanza Giuffrida, Chloé Rutzerveld.

EXPERTS Cor van der Weele, Daisy van der Schaft, Mark Post, Menno Stoffelsen, Ronald van Tienhoven, Arne Hendriks, Janine Huizinga, Flip Ziedses des Plantes, Joris van Gelder.

Can we make a book? We already have!

We made a book before, and we can do it again. Published in 2011, Next Nature: nature changes along with us is a 500-page compendium of our best blog posts, essays and visual material. Thanks to our first book, we’re now seasoned pros when it comes to print publishing. We guarantee that In Vitro Meat Cookbook will come with the sparkling text and design we’ve promised, and that you’ll get your copy in a timely manner. 

Still not convinced? Check out these excerpts from our book! 



PRAISE ON OUR PREVIOUS BOOK

"Next Nature can give us a new vocabulary and a new philosophy to see
and design the world." – Scientific American

"Einem der spannendste Bücher, das mir seit langem untergekommen ist"
– Page Magazine

"The Next Nature movement is about trying to shake ourselves out of our
sleepwalk." – Architects Journal

"Easily browsable with its short essay format and engaging graphics,
'next nature' offers an expansive survey of present day technologies and the
philosophies with which we understand them." – Designboom.com

"It has been a while since I had such a fascinating coffee table book (if
I may call it that) in my hands." – Treehugger

"A book unlike any other, with bold graphics and statements, intriguing
information about things anyone can relate to." – Treehugger.com

"An overwhelming book in the expanding twilight between technology,
nature and design" – Knack Weekend

"Next Nature is an equally provocative as convincing book" – Metropolis M

"A new Ark" – Domus Magazine

"Book of the Year" – Trendbeheer

WATCH THE NEXT NATURE BOOK TRAILER



Background info: in vitro meat for dummies

Want to know more about in vitro meat technology? Watch this short animated video for a beginner's introduction to the why and how of in vitro meat.


Video from Prof. Mark Post where he announces his intention to make the world's first cultured hamburger at our 2011 Next Nature Power Show event.

Or watch this short item on the Dutch Evening News visiting our expo of speculative In Vitro meat visions at the Future Food house event.

Press

  • Guardian Interview on our in vitro meat visions
  • Dutch Evening News on our meat ice presentation
  • Wired Design: See through Sushi Anyone?
  • Boing Boing: Crowdfunding an In Vitro Meat Cookbook.
  • ABC News: In Vitro Meat Recipe Book.
  • Italian Newspaper La Repubblica on our future meat visions
  • Solution or Horrorscenario? Interview with HorecaEntree (Dutch).
  • Interview on the cookcook on Motherboard (Dutch).

Want to write about the project? Download the Mediakit.

Want to do more?

Want to do more besides receiving a copy of the book with your name in it, obtaining your own cooking set or joining us for the concept dinner? Help us spread the word on the project by linking to this campaign and don't forget to join in on our Thunderclap campaign as well. It is free! We are really is helped with your support. Thanks people. Together we determine the future of meat!

story:
Summary 

Hi! My name is Kim Brown and I'm a second year Master of Journalism student at Ryerson University in Toronto, Canada. My interest in surveillance began when I enrolled in an undergraduate seminar a few years ago, and now I'm using it as my topic for my major research project (which is similar to a thesis).

 I am planning to produce and publish a newspaper series which will focus on surveillance, democracy and why privacy should matter to us. I want to paint a big picture about how often we are watched, who does the watching, where our information goes and how a loss of privacy might affect us later. My goal is not to scare people or simply state that surveillance is either good or bad, but to write in depth about the reality of the multiple layers of surveillance we encounter today and hopefully change the way citizens think about being monitored, tracked and/or watched.     

Traveling to London will be very important for me because there is a wealth of information about surveillance there. And, since it has been labelled a "surveillance society" due to the high volume of CCTV cameras, I feel it will be advantageous for me to go there and experience what is it like to live in that environment so I can compare and contrast it to my own city. I will be travelling all around London documenting all the different ways I am watched, and will be conducting several interviews with professors, locals, privacy activists, city officials and organizations that support the use of surveillance. 


What I Need & What You Get 

I am asking for $600 for this trip, but any amount I raise will be greatly appreciated. I will be flying to London for 7 days in the middle of February. I was very fortunate to receive a travel grant from my school and that money has covered my flight.

The funds I raise here will go towards:

  • My hostel - about $300 (Canadian) 
  • Transportation which includes a weeklong pass for public transit - about $150 (Canadian) 
  • Food/caffeine - about $75 (Canadian)  
  • Technology/accessories including electric plug adapter, batteries for camera and voice recorder, insurance for school camera  - about $50 (Canadian) 
  • Miscellaneous - $25 (Canadian)    
If you like stuff from England, I might be able to help you too! For $10 I will send you a postcard, for $25 a trendy mug, and for $50 your very own authentic bag of tea.  

The Impact

As mentioned before, anything you can contribute will be most appreciated. The more places I can go, the more information I can collect, and the better (and more publishable) my project will be. At the end of the series, I am hoping to create a policy that both the watchers and the watched can abide by and prove that privacy still matters, even if we have nothing to hide.

Technology/accessories including electric plug adapter, batteries for camera and voice recorder, insurance for school camera  - about $50 (Canadian) 

Miscellaneous - $25 (Canadian)    

If you like stuff from England, I might be able to help you too! For $10 I will send you a postcard, for $25 a trendy mug, and for $50 your very own authentic bag of tea.  The ImpactAs mentioned before, anything you can contribute will be most appreciated. The more places I can go, the more information I can collect, and the better (and more publishable) my project will be. At the end of the series, I am hoping to create a policy that both the watchers and the watched can abide by and prove that privacy still matters, even if we have nothing to hide.

story:
Every donation counts! Here’s why:


Donate:

$3 covers the meal costs for one child each month

$8 covers the learning instruction for one child each month

$10 covers the art supplies for all the children each month

$50 covers the monthly salary of a teaching assistant

$100 covers the monthly salary of a special needs teacher


About me and Project idea

I am Lizzie and for those who don't know me personally yet I am very passionate about personal development, consciousness evolution, mindfulness, meditation, creativity, psychology, philosophy, art, art therapy, intuition, holistic healing and well-being, cultural diversity and independent thinking, contributing to making the world a better place. 

Through my volunteering experience with PETE India NGO working in its schools in the slums of New Delhi I have discovered the most amazing, inspiring and happy children and people....It is utterly amazing how real happiness doesn't cost anything and people in the slums constantly remind you that. I feel so honored to have been given a chance to interact with kids and girls in the school, bring my creative input and help them foster their imagination as "only sky is the limit".

I spent time with the locals and I got to meet the families and special needs children in the slums....My heart was filled with joy by those encounters and by being able to make art and spend time with those children who are beyond amazing. Because of their special needs conditions and the fact that there is no infrastructure nor knowledge in the families on how to handle them I feel something has to be done to improve the quality of life of those children and their families. I think opening a new PETE Special Needs School would totally make an impact and go a long way. Therefore I had this idea to fundraise to help set up and run the school for the first year.

Not everyone can travel and often when we face different realities in third world countries it is difficult to find a way to actively do something....So I was thinking how nice it would be if everyone could take a little part in this...just  like giving up a little something in your everyday life can be anything like your treat of tea/coffee or something bigger like a perk or a larger contribution...whatever you feel like....anything could go along way in this project.... So what do you say are you in?

Sandeep and all other special needs children, their families and community would have a wonderful chance of a brighter happier future and we can make that happen....I believe this project is the most special gift for them:)


What We Need & What You Get

This great project would need 3500$ to start up the School for Special Needs Children. The funding would cover for the school costs for the first year. This would include the rent of the small school, the salary for a special need teacher and two teacher assistants, some basic supplies and art supplies of course because I believe they are essential to cultivate freedom, imagination and well being!!!!. I truly believe that once the school is running more potential can be achieved and more people may be interested in developing it more....It just needs to get started:)

I truly hope that the funds target can be reached as a little contribution that seems tiny can really go a long way here!!!!However, if this does not happen the funds will be used to start the project for a shorter time given what is available. The PETE staff and myself will make sure that everything is looked after and document the process of this project!!!

PETE also handle amazing handmade things my by the local community it supports... So if you feel like getting a tangible something to get to know the people and connect with this project you can choose some of the perks below here:) Shipping may take a little while depending on destinations and Indian post...It works quite well as I have been using it a lot while out here!!!


The Impact

I believe that this project is a beautiful drop into the ocean of love and kindness we can all share.... Connecting and helping others to achieve happiness and a better quality of life is just so amazing that words can't even describe...

Being part of this is just your great chance to help make the world a better place and bring more smiles on Sandeep and other kids and families. I love the idea that friends, family and strangers can connect to this project and make it happen raising beautiful energy...I am so glad to be part of this that I would like to invite anyone who cares to join and follow upcoming ones:)

Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions of want to know more!!! I am here supporting this project because it is awesome...


More about PETE:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pete.india.1

Web: http://www.peteindia.org/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/PeteindiaPete


In case you want to know more about me and what I do...

My social media links :)

LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/pub/lizzie-bellotto/14/431/8a6 
Academia.edu: http://ucl.academia.edu/LizzieBellotto 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/lizzieartnsurf‎ 
Google Plus: https://plus.google.com/101553519519616741897 
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/lizzie.bellotto 
Web/blog: http://artevolutions.wordpress.com/ https://www.facebook.com/ArtevolutionsLab 
Pinterest: http://www.pinterest.com/lizzieartnsurf/ 
GOOD: http://www.good.is/members/lizzie-bellotto


Other Ways You Can Help

Even though a tiny something is all it matters I understand that some people may not be able to contribute...If you care about this project and believe in me please get the word out, share this awesome campaign through your social media....

Indiegogo sharing tools are there to help:)

Thank you so much

Love and Light

Lizzie and PETE team

story:
Help Manos Unidas launch, Phawarispa, the FIRST and ONLY WORK TRAINING PROGRAM for YOUNG ADULTS with SPECIAL NEEDS in Cusco, Peru.

We have the students.  We have the experience and knowledge.  We have the building.

Now we NEED YOUR HELP to FURNISH IT!

WHO WE ARE  

Founded in 2007 by a local Peruvian school teacher (Rosa Mercedes Delgado Chávez) and an American psychologist (Celeste Nicole Marion), Manos Unidas (“United Hands”) was only a dream to bring quality, life changing education to special needs children and their families in Cusco. Beginning with 2 kids in our living room, Manos Unidas opened its doors in a country and a region that put children with special needs second.  

Now a reality, Manos Unidas has educated over 150 students (3-13 years old) and currently employees 24 professionals.  No longer located in a living room, the school, Camino Nuevo, has 30 students in its current location and the Inclusion Program has 23 students in 4 public schools being taught by 5 Manos Unidas’ employed teachers.  With the launch of Phawarispa, Manos Unidas will hire 6 more professionals to teach an additional 30 students.

THE NEXT STEP 

Manos Unidas’ newest program, "Phawarispa" (“Running Together”) a Dr. Cynthia Carolina Cáceres Baker Project, is the next step for Manos Unidas' students and the community.  The program is intended to prepare the students to enter society with:

  1. Transition Education for Adolescents (13-16 years old); and
  2. Vocational Training for Young Adults (17-25 years old).

The program will offer students employment training in 3 areas:

  1. Housekeeping in Hotels;
  2. Restaurants; and
  3. Gardening + Raising Small Animals.

Learn more about Phawarispa here.

WHAT WE NEED

The project opens soon. We have the space for the school, but it is empty!  We need $15,000 to launch!

We need to fully equip a 2 story, 17 room house, the beautiful garden and small store. We also need to cover investment expenses with new staff until we reach our target goal of 25 students. 

ROOMS + AREAS include:

  • Classrooms (4)
  • Kitchen
  • Restaurant
  • Arts Space
  • Garden
  • Bathrooms (2)
  • Offices
  • Living Room 
  • Small Store

The Children of Peru Foundation has already donated $5,000, a portion of the capital needed to start on a skeleton budget, but we need additional funds to launch!

MATCHING FUNDS

For every $1 donated, we will receive $2 more from two donor groups (up to $15,000/each) for potential total of $45,000*. 

* $15,000 (Indiegogo)  +  $15,000 (Children of Peru Foundation)  +  $15,000 (Anonymous Donors In Memory of Dr. Cynthia Carolina Cáceres Baker)  =  $45,000! 

If you give $25, our donors will give us $50 more!  Want to donate $500?  Our donors will give $1000!

WHAT ELSE YOU CAN DO...

SHARE this page on Facebook + Twitter + Google+

LIKE + FOLLOW @ Facebook + Twitter

VOLUNTEER your time + skills + heart

SPONSOR a SCHOLARSHIP for as little as $25 / month

The not so small print...

All funds received by this campaign are directed to the Children of Peru Foundation for matching purposes.  Children of Peru Foundation is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt charity.   All donations are tax deductible in the U.S.  The Children of Peru Foundation has a perfect 5 star rating on GuideStar.org.

Additionally, a portion of the funds provided by the matching donors will be used towards Camino Nuevo and the Inclusion Program.

Learn more about our students + programs @ www.manosunidasperu.net

Have more questions?  Contact us @ manosunidasintl@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

I have 74 hours to collect enough money for a 6 week online art program with one of the masters of our time and through technology I can study under him from a completely different place in the world. Why 74 hours? Well, I recently discovered this program and after discussing it with my parents - I will only have 1 week of summer left (to prepare for my Sophomore year of high school) if I start this program as soon as possible - which would be this coming week of June 10th.  This gives me one weekend to raise the money. I'm really thankful for anyone that has read this and hope you can support me!

Thanks again,

- Valerie Hernandez :)

 

 

I highly recommend you to read the below so you can learn more about me, my art, and the program. 


Who are you?

Hi, my name is Valerie Hernandez. I'm 15 years old and I've recently finished a busy freshman school year of all honor classes, advanced art classes, and my own artistic goals. I'm very dedicated to doing well both academically and artistically so I can set myself up for the best in college. I spend hours everyday drawing, researching, and studying art. I'm really enthusiastic about animation and illustration which is something I'm looking forward to studying in college. 

 

Where can I see more of your art?

You can find me at http://valerie-hernandez.blogspot.com/


How did you get started? 

I started art before I can remember, but more as a hobby at the time. I remember drawing Pixar (Disney) cassette tape covers on my bedroom floor because I was fascinated with them, specifically "It's A Bug's Life". Ever since I've had a desire to grow up and become an artist. Though, it wasn't until my 8th grade year in middle school where I picked up a book by a Japanese movie maker, Hayao Miyazaki. I was hooked. I wanted to grow up as an artist, yes, but now I knew more specifics. I knew I wanted to go into the Animation industry.

I knew this was not only something I wanted to do, but something I needed to do. So I asked and read and listened to everything available to me from books and podcasts to teachers and other art students. I was passionately curious. I started drawing from life as I was advised to do. Which was a great adventure figuring out how to start and finding various paths to take. I moved into reading lots and lots of art books, like "Drawn to Life", "Burne Hogarth's Figure Drawing", and many others.  


Where are you at now?

I'm currently on my second year of pursuing this dream. I'm still tuning my skills that will allow me to expand my artistic endeavors. I'm in high school part of an advanced visual art program.


How did you find this art program?

As I was researching the web for resources and possible a class I could take this summer to further my goals, I found Vilppu Academy run by an extraordinary artist, Glen Vilppu. Since traveling to study with this artist would be extremely difficult for my family, I was lucky enough to find out that this artist can instruct you via internet. This means I can study under this artist right from my own home! 

 

What is the art program?

The rigorous art program is 6 weeks. I would be studying the fundamentals of art - which I feel would prepare me to study the figure when my parents allow me to go that direction. It is $600 and the money would go directly to Vilppu Academy. The academy is for anyone from beginner to art instructors to even artists in the industry. People have taken the program over and over to refine their skills, which I find pretty incredible!

The basics of the program are as follows:

1. You get an assignment a week just like a college setting.

2. You watch a video lecture along with that assignment. 

3. You complete the assignment on your own.

4. You send him a picture of your work through email.

5. He then critiques and draws over/next to your work - each week you get feedback (which you can reply over and over again!).

 

Some benefits of this program:

- You can see other students' critiques. 

- You can chat with other students and with the instructor live.

 

Who is Glenn Vilppu (the instructor)?

Glenn Vilppu teaches renowned art classes around the world on observational drawing. He has worked at Walt Disney Animation studios and various colleges/art instruction programs. Here is his website: http://vilppuacademy.com/

 

What happens if you don't raise enough money?

The funds with stay in a savings account until I can raise enough money to start the program next summer. The program is open from June - August each year.

 

Other ways to help?

Send this to anyone and everyone you can! You can also keep track of my art at my blog (valerie-hernandez.blogspot.com).

Send this to anyone and everyone you can! You can also keep track of my art at my blog (valerie-hernandez.blogspot.com).

story:
Our Story

Bella, born in the Jiangxi province of China, has the opportunity to travel back to see her birth country this summer. Help her get there so she can experience the culture of her birthplace.


The Impact

As an adoptee from China, Bella hasn't been there since the age of 1. This trip will take her back to the province where she was born, and give her a deeper understanding of where she came from. She'll be seeing many of the great sights of China like the Great Wall and Forbidden City, as well as visiting the rural area where she was born.


Your help will make it easier for Bella to experience as much as possible on this 2 1/2 week trip.


What We Need & What You Get

The Chinese government is helping with this trip, but they don't cover everything.  Bella really wants to do some special things, like having her picture taken with a toddler Panda.  This trip is a rare opportunity, so we want her to have as rich an experience as possible.  Help her raise the money for these special parts of the trip and you'll get a copy of her picture with the Panda.  :)


Other Ways You Can Help

We are always amazed at how many people we run into who know someone who is adopted from somewhere or are themselves adopted. Share this with anyone you think might be interested in helping a young lady make sure she experiences the fullness of her birthplace and gain an understanding of where she is from.

story:
Who we are?

Missions de Solidarite Responsable International is a youth driven charity organization established in 2009.

We are a group of young passionate students and professionals that doesn’t want to just sit around and watch as the world goes by. There are many problems in our world today and we want to take charge and make a difference by providing long-lasting, sustainable solutions to the issues we can face.



What we do?

Our local projects include arts, robotic and science afterschool programs at the Kateri Tekakwitha primary school in Kahnawake, a first nation’s territory, and martial arts classes at the Maison des Jeunes Cote-des-Neiges, a youth center in the heart of Montreal.  These programs provide underprivileged youth with activities that not only keep them out of trouble, but improve their discipline, self-esteem and social abilities. We hope that the will grow into individuals with positive values and an appreciation of helping others.

Our main work is done abroad in developing countries during one-month summer missions. In Haiti, Ghana and Laos, we work hand in hand with existing structures such as grassroots organizations, high schools, orphanages, hospitals and community centers. Our missions involve educational and environmental development through science, theater, humanities and martial arts workshops for the youth and the educators, as well as tree planting projects.

Furthermore, we offer a unique medical internship program that provides an exceptional opportunity for medical students to shadow physicians in their daily routines and see firsthand the work they do. These future doctors learn about the functioning of a hospital along with helping and gaining an insight of the work, such as setting up mobile clinics in rural or deprived areas. These missions give these young medical students the opportunity to learn in a different environment, invest in their potential and it encourages them to come back and volunteer as fully qualified doctors in the future.



How we make a difference?

We understand that serious problems require seriously committed individuals who want to do their best. For this reason, at MSR the process of selecting a volunteer is very important. Our volunteers go through a unique cultural training prior and throughout their missions. This eye opening, personal and career building experience allows them to contribute to the development of the communities while obtaining new skills. The structure of our missions initiates an exchange of knowledge, culture and a positive interaction that mutually benefits the communities, volunteers and our partners.



We don't believe in charity for charity' sake. MSR has three main philosophies:


  1. MSR is committed to express transparency and accountability in all of our work.
  1. We envision that our volunteers will build on their experiences with MSR and use their cultural, personal and professional training to become citizens with a more responsible vision and increased awareness of today's developing world and its issues. Our vision of sustainable development is that our volunteers will in turn grow into great leaders and will use their skills to improve our world.
  1. We believe that by providing real and relevant knowledge to the communities in need, we truly empower them to continue helping themselves once we leave. We hope our work helps them to realize their potential and continue building their communities today and into the future.




Why we need your help?

For the last three years, our hard working founders, directors and small local fundraisers, have been the backbone of funding MSR. But we hope that via our Indiegogo exposure we will find people that believe in our cause and will help support our programs.

By the end of this campaign, your valuable donations will be solely for mission activities in Haiti and Ghana. The breakdown consists of:


  • 6000$= mission costs in Ghana well as the supplies for the organization of a mobile clinic in the Volta Region.
  • 9000$= mission costs in Haiti that include food, transportation and accommodation for the university students from Port-au-Prince, equipment for soccer tournament, educational supplies and food for Chemistry and Biology training sessions in Limbe, tree planting initiative in Mirebalais.


And don’t forget the awesome rewards on your right that you will get for your dollars!

Other ways you can help:

  • Come with us on a summer mission to contribute to the sustainable development first hand. Contact us if you are interested in learning about new cultures, gaining invaluable knowledge about your field of study and having the time of your life!
  • Share our campaign with your friends and family and like our facebook page to bring awareness to our missions.
  • Contact us if you would like to donate any educational supplies, sports equipment as well as shoes and clothes, etc. We will be sending a container to Haiti this summer to support our partners and friends.
  • If you are from Montreal and would like to provide a helping hand in our local programs, don’t hesitate to contact us. The more the merrier.  ïŠ


Contact info:

info@msr-intl.com

https://www.facebook.com/msrintl

www.msr-intl.com




We thank you in advance for all your help!
Sincerely,
Clement, Dana, Elnaz, Jonathan, Julie, Marta, Mimi, Paul, Val, Victor and Zied.

story:
Thank you everybody for your shares, support and donations. We made it!! 

Can you still donate? Yes you can! Indiegogo will keep sending any donations you make to us, and we will keep investing that in students. 
Can you also invest in our students? Yes you can! Visit our website www.brighterinvestment.com/investors and contact us at inquiries@brighterinvestment.com for more information.

100 dollars can fund an entire university degree?

Over time, yes! Here's how:

  • Your 100 dollar contribution will fund a student in Ghana through one university subject this year.
  • When this student graduates, they will repay 30% of their employment income for a period of 6 years or less. This money will be reinvested to support another student through two university subjects.
  • When that student graduates, their repayments will in turn support another student through four university subjects. Over time, the money will continue to multiply.
  • In 25 years, the 100 dollars you contribute today will support an entire university degree! Not only that, but it will have helped support many students along the way. And it will continue growing after that.



Why are we doing this?

We are a social impact startup inspired by the problem that for many students in developing countries, a university degree is out of reach simply because they are unable to pay for it. We believe that education has the power to transform lives. And we believe it's possible to remove financial barriers to higher education.

Benefits of Higher Education:

Individual benefits:

  • Better employment opportunities
  • Improved health outcomes and longer lifespans
  • Next generation more likely to advance their education
Social benefits:
  • More skilled workforce and economic growth
  • Increased political participation
  • Reduction in crime and violence

The Impact

  • If we reach our goal, the money from this crowdfunding campaign will support 10 students through university in Ghana this year. We provide students with full funding (tuition, fees, books/supplies, housing, and a living stipend), so they can focus on their studies.
  • When these 10 students graduate and begin working, the money they repay will be reinvested to support 20 new students. Over time, the numbers will continue to grow.
  • Even if we don't reach our goal, we will still contribute all the money to education support. 

Your Contribution:

  • Your contribution will be used to support students in Ghana according to our model. This means student repayments are reinvested in new students! In addition to financially supporting students, we provide them with regular mentorship and support in seeking employment.



Our Model

Unlike a traditional loan, where graduates are expected to repay the full amount plus interest, we ask graduates to repay a fixed percentage of their income for a set number of years.

This income-based repayment model has two advantages:

  1. It is better guarded against inflation than a traditional loan. In developing countries, uncertainty about inflation leads to very high interest rates on traditional loans. Furthermore, students from disadvantaged backgrounds are often ineligible for loans due to a lack of collateral.
  2. It lowers the risk for students, ensuring that they never end up with debt they can't repay. Our model includes a minimum payment level, so if a student cannot find well-paying work, he or she is not expected to repay.

What about Scholarships?

Scholarships are another vehicle for supporting talented students through university. However, scholarships are generally limited to a few students. With our model, money used to support students grows over time, so we can support increasing numbers of students through university. In twenty years time, the $20,000 from this campaign will be worth over $100,000 in student support! 

Is it Fair/Ethical to Expect Repayments from Students?

We believe it is fair to ask students to repay a portion of their income for a set period of time after they graduate. Rather than recipients of charity, we view our students as partners, creating value for themselves, investors, and other students. Students have full freedom to choose their career path.



More About Brighter Investment

Brighter Investment allows private investors and/or private donors to fund the education of deserving students from disadvantaged backgrounds. When funding is provided as investment, investors can choose to collect student repayments or to reinvest the repayments to support additional students. We target a return on investment (ROI) of 9%. When repayments are reinvested they are used to support increasing numbers of students.

Risks and Challenges

  • Life does not always go as planned. Students may need to repeat a semester or may drop out of university, and graduates may default on their repayments. We have incorporated estimates of these events in our financial models. We believe that cultivating strong relationships with students offers the best protection against the risk of default.
  • As a startup, we are continually learning, growing, and adapting. Over the next year, we will be raising capital to expand our program and scale our model. We believe that once we have established our model using the funds from this campaign, we will attract investors who are interested in investing in companies with scalable social impact and high growth potential. However, even if we fail to raise capital to grow our company, we are committed to supporting 10 students from this campaign throughout their degrees.


FAQs

  • Is 30% a lot? Graduate incomes are 3x-5x higher with a degree. A fixed repayment percentage of 30% means students repay for a relatively short period of time. A student who receives support over their full 4-year degree will be debt-free within 6 years; a student who receives support for 2 years will be debt free within 3 years.  This includes a national service period where students are not expected to repay.
  • What if a student defaults on their repayments? We believe that building relationships is one of the best ways to prevent students from defaulting on repayments. Over the course of their degrees, Brighter Students will get to know one another, and will be in regular contact with a mentor through our program. Because some things are outside of our control, we have also included a default risk estimate in our financial models.
  • What if a student doesn't find a job? Students are not required to repay until they find a job with salary above a minimum payment threshold. We provide career support to students, and are building a network of employers in Ghana.
  • How do you select students? Students are asked to provide standardized test scores and a teacher recommendation as part of their application. Research has shown that a teacher recommendation is one of the best indicators of student success.
  • Do you support all degree programs?  We have researched the earning potential of various degrees in Ghana. As we launch the program, we are focusing on students with high earning potential - primarily Science, Engineering, and post-graduate degree programs. Over time, we hope we can expand our list of supported degrees.
  • What type of mentorship will students receive? Students will be in regular phone contact with a Ghanaian student mentor, who will serve as a friend, guide, and support.  Once/semester they will meet this mentor in person.
  • Are you active at particular universities Ghana? We have partnerships with three reputable universities in Ghana: University of Ghana (UG), Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology (KNUST), and University of Mines and Technology (UMaT).  We will expand to more universities in years to come.
  • Why Ghana? We are launching our program in Ghana because of good employment opportunities, a stable government and limited corruption. At the same time, fewer than 5% of young people in Ghana attend university. We believe our model would work well in other countries (such as India, South Africa, and Indonesia) and we hope to expand to other countries once we have established our program in Ghana.
If you have any other questions, feel free to get in touch by email! h.mann@brighterinvestment.com


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially. If you support our mission, you can still help in the following ways:

  • Spread the word on Facebook, by inviting your friends to our site, or re-posting
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools


Thanks for your help in making higher education accessible to deserving students!

story:
Hi everyone!
My name is Tyler Stobbe and a little background on me, I am 20 years old and studying at the University of North Carolina at Greensboro. I am a senior, majoring in Information Systems and Operations Management. I am a first generation college student in my family. My family was extremely proud of me for going to college. They also fully support me in my decision to go to Australia.

I knew early on that furthering my education was something important to me. I went to an early college high school and actually got my Associate's degree before I graduated high school. Less than two years later, here I am, a senior in college coming upon my final semester for my undergraduate. Once I graduate, I do have plans to go and get my Master's degree.

I have taken some great opportunities since I've been at my university, and my latest is that I want to study abroad. For as long as I can remember, I have wanted to visit Australia, but honestly thought that would never happen. After seeing several presentations on campus and in class, I discovered that my university has a GREAT study abroad department and loves for their students to be culturally diverse, go out of their comfort zone, and become more open minded. I took advantage of that, applied, and got accepted to the program of my choice.

In July, I will go to Australia and study at the University of Technology in Sydney. To say the least, I am excited. However, it is VERY expensive to get over there, and expensive to live. I really really don't want finances to be the one thing holding me back from this dream of mine. So if you guys could donate absolutely anything, I can assure you that it will not be wasted and I will be very grateful for it.

The money would be used for my flight over to Australia and back, tuition, fees, books, housing, and food while I am abroad.

You can also help by getting my story out. Share my wish with your friends, family and others because I could use all the support I can get.

For any questions or comments, you can contact me at tmstobbe@uncg.edu.

Thanks again!

story:
“Do your little bit of good where you are; it’s those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.” – Desmond Tutu

Hunger is a problem that plagues this world in a time where food is abundant. There are deficiencies in the value chain of food systems that have failed us all. But we want to change that. We are students from Northeastern University’s Social Enterprise Institute, who want to be able to do our own little bits of good, and overwhelm the world. Please help us fund our trip to the Appalachia in March where we plan to work with multiple organizations to create sustainable social impact in the local food systems.

As students from different academic backgrounds we all come together in the capstone course, Advanced Studies of Social Enterprise, a class focused in the studies of the food system value chain. Each one of us has a different reason for becoming involved in the social space, but have the same end goal of wanting the change the world for the better by using sustainable business practices. Our objectives may be daunting, but that does not frighten any of us. All 14 of us have the passion and drive to do what it takes to see changes happen in our lifetime.

Our course requires a week long field study in Tennessee where we will implement participatory framework designs into local organizations to help create sustainable and replicable social impact. Some of the institutions we will be working with are Thistle Farms, in Nashville, TN, Berea College Entrepreneurship for the Public Good, in Berea, KY, Clearfork Community Institute, in Eagan, TN, and Highlander Center, in New Market, TN. Our efforts will be towards learning what practices from these enterprises are replicable and how we can include them into future innovations of the food system. By working directly with the communities we can introduce or expand the participatory elements in each organization.

What does it mean to be participatory? How can outsiders possibly know the answers to all problems that distress others? There has to be inclusion and knowledge from the affected first hand by issues. Communities should not only help define, but be a part of the solution. Inclusion and transparency are two areas on which we want out actions to focus. Participatory frameworks are key to helping create the most effective and efficient solutions to the social problems this world is facing.

Unfortunately, this field work is not included into tuition of our class. Each student has to pay out of pocket to travel. Our flights, accommodations, interstate ground transportation, and meals are all part of the expenses that each student must cover. We are trying to significantly reduce the cost per student for this unique learning experience, so no one students feels they cannot attend due to financial restrictions. Your donation will help us gain valuable hands-on experience in the social enterprise sector, while directly supporting enterprise-based solutions that can be replicated globally in the food value chain.

story:
For many, a college education represents the opportunity to enhance your quality of life and build a secure future. But with rising college costs, students are forced to take out huge loans to finance their education. Then once graduation comes, students are saddled with huge debts that can prevent them from actualizing their dreams.

The Fight Sallie Mae Project aims to disrupt this system by providing college graduates with the tools, resources & bailout program they need to Knock Student Loan Debt Out.

Here’s the problem: Since 1978, the cost of a college degree has increase by more than 1,120%. Due to such massive inflation, the average cost of tuition at a public, 4 year college in 2014 is nearly $90,000! But the average family income is only about $50,000. This financial gap then forces students & their families take to out loans to finance their education.

Due to such large debts (and other factors such as underemployment & high loan interest rates), students often can't pay back their loans which leads them to default, and prevents them from successfully building a life for themselves.

The Fight Sallie Mae Project aims to create a complete resource that provides college students (and graduates) with easy-to-understand action steps that walk them through how to realistically pay off their loans. Through our website FightSallie.org, students will have access to:

And just by visiting our site, you’ll help to fund our Student Bailout Program: Fight Back. 

Our vision is to eliminate student loan debt for as many US college graduates as we possibly can. If we can raise our goal amount of $250,000 we will be able to:

Today’s students are always online, so to best connect with them, we need to build a digital hub that’s easily accessible by any platform. With successful funding, the anticipated release of our website will be May 2015.

We want to provide students with essential information to avoid, manage, and eliminate their loans, and we want to share this data in formats that are the easiest to share and digest. With the amount pledged here, we’ll be able to create over 100 entertaining and informational videos and the associated downloadable reference guides/action plans. 

We plan to start purchasing and forgiving student loans starting in November 2015 in Philadelphia. From the initial amount that we raise here, we'll be able to forgive $500K of student loan debt. After this point, we plan to expand this system and ultimately forgive over $5 million dollars worth of student loans by 2020.

Whether we reach our funding goal or not, we promise that every dollar pledged here will be used to helping students finance their education and putting them on the path to upward mobility.

We know that our goal is ambitious, but with your help, we can make the pursuit of the American Dream more affordable for students.

We've hit the $1000 mark and to celebrate we’re launching a new referral program that we hope excites you as much as it excites us!

Now if you pledge $5 or more to our campaign, you will earn 10% commission on every pledge you bring in!

How it Works: After you’ve donated, log into Indiegogo to get your personal tracking URL, then press the share buttons on our page or share your unique URL (the link below our video at the top of the page). Then have your friends donate to our campaign through your link and earn money. That’s It!

You can even track your progress by visiting your IndieGoGo “My Profile” page and clicking on “Referrals”!

Once again, Thank YOU for helping us reach this major milestone!


We understand if you can't donate to this campaign (believe me when I say we understand the college grad struggle), but here's what you can do if you'd like to support: 

  1. Signup for our Mailing List! This will help us see how many people think this is a necessary project, plus it will help us to notify you when FightSallie.org launches!
  2. Send out this Awesome Tweet! This will generate an automatic tweet that you can send to your followers.
  3. Share our campaign video/page with as many people as you can! Facebook it, Tweet it, Tumblr it, whatever!
  4. Join our Thunderclap! Help us spread our message to the entire world!
  5. Talk about us on and offline. We need to expose this project to as many people as possible in order to maximize the chances of making the resource a reality. Because just like we said in the video, alone we can pack a punch, but together we can knock student loan debt out.

The Fight Sallie Mae Project is the work of current and graduated college students who have firsthand experience with the struggle of trying to pay off student loan debt. It is our collective experience and our hope for the future that drives and inspires us to make a difference. 

Are You Guys Single-Handedly Trying to Take Out Student Loan Debt?

Buying Student Loan Debt? Is This Even Possible?

How does Debt Buying Work?

Can You Cancel All My Loans?

Can You Help Everyone?

Are You Guys Single-Handedly Trying to Take Out Student Loan Debt?

The issue of student debt is too large for just one organization to handle and even if we raised 1.2 trillion dollars, it would only help mollify the student loan problem, not solve it. Ultimately, there will have to be an entire reform of how the US views, funds and values post-secondary education. But until that time comes, we hope the resources provided through our website can help as many students as possible.

Buying Student Loan Debt? Is This Even Possible?

Yes! In fact, earlier this year, Occupy Wall Street did the same thing and helped to forgive over $4 million dollars of student loan debt.

How Does Buying Debt Work?

Banks sell debt for pennies on the dollar to a market of debt buyers who then turn around and try to collect the full amount from debtors. The Fight Sallie Mae project will intervene by buying debt, keeping it out of the hands of collectors, and then erasing it.

Can You Cancel All My Loans?

Unfortunately, due to the process of buying debt, we cannot purchase any particular individual’s loan debt. Nor will we be able to completely buy out your student loan debt. Furthermore, debt that we purchase will only cover private education loans, like those provided by banks. Unfortunately we cannot purchase public loans (yet) because they are owned by the government, but we are looking for ways around this!

Can You Help Everyone?

We'd like to think so. Even though we can't purchase everyone's debt, we hope that through our digital library students can find the tools they need to manage and minimize their student loans.

Thank you for taking the time to learn more about us! We truly appreciate your attention and support! Now let's get this project funded!

story:
For The Kids is focused on raising money and awareness for the Child Advocacy Center of Oswego County.

The Child Advocacy Center is a non-profit organization that’s mission is to provide a safe, child-friendly environment that supports a timely, multi-disciplinary response to child sexual abuse, physical abuse and trauma, and promotes healing of victims and their families.

Through fundraising events and online donations, For The Kids' goal is to raise $10,000 for the CAC so they can continue to assist the children of Oswego County, which has the highest amount of reported child abuse incidences in the entire state.

Together we can help those who need it most.

Together we can help put an end to child abuse.

Please visit our Facebook and Twitter pages to follow our fundraising efforts and updates on us reaching our goal for the CAC.

Twitter: @FTKoz

Facebook: For The Kids

story:
Every day, 1000's of Syrians are fleeing the war and devastation within their country and embarking on dangerous and life threatening  journeys to try and find help and security. Refugees arriving in neighbouring countries have no food or shelter. We are raising money to support convoys of supplies that are being shipped in the coming weeks delivering essential ‘Emergency Aid’ including food, clothing, medicine and other essentials to these desperate souls.

The images of the young boys body washed up on a beach in Europe deeply shocked us all and brought home the reality of the situation.  As this little boys body is laying to rest in his home land of Syria, we believe that together we can make a difference to end the suffering. We want to show the world the love and generosity of the people of Norfolk as well as our solidarity to those fleeing war and devastation.  We believe in love with no borders - Join us to to spread the message!

Money raised will support the convoy to ship 'Emergency Supplies' such as food, clothes,blankets and medicines to the Greece / Macedonia border where 1000's of desperate people are arriving daily.

The first convoy is leaving on Thursday 10th September with another to follow in approx 2 weeks time.

FromNRwithlove is a small charity spreading love & care from the Norfolk community. We are a small group of friends that believe if we all work together, we can make a difference.
