story:
Author Visits With An Impact!

 

How I Got Started In This

My name is Jefferson Knapp and I am the author of a children's book series called The Kingdom at the End of the Driveway. In 2010 I was asked to speak at a local elementary school about my newly-published book, The Brave Journey. After seeing the kids' reaction, I decided my passion would be getting children excited about reading.

Before I became an author, I worked as a groundskeeper for a school district. When the economy fell, I lost my job, but luckily I had already started my first book. I have seen first-hand the consequences of budget-cuts to schools. Whether you're for the cut-backs or against them, I've found that most schools are unable to afford high-cost author visits.

I decided to keep my author fee low so any school could afford me; however, I can't reach the school if I can't offset the funds to get there. The impact my presentations have on schools is too important to pass up over the issue of money. There is nothing better than hearing from librarians that their reluctant readers are on the waiting list to check out my books.

Excitement in my book series is spreading with each elementary I visit, but there are many more schools to reach. Imagine the positive impact on this country if a new generation were raised to be avid readers instead of TV junkies and video game addicts. I believe you and I can make a difference!

 

How I Will Spend The Money

The $10,000 I'm hoping to raise will go toward my travels to far away schools and help fund the fourth book in The Kingdom at the End of the Driveway series. It costs close to $20,000 to publish a new book (editing, illustrating, book designing, printing). This money will help pay for part of the cost.

In return, I will offer some attractive perks for your generous donations: signed dust jackets, books autographed by the author, illustrator and book designer, special thanks in an upcoming book and the opportunity to be a character in Book Four! 

 

Money Isn't The Only Way To Help

It would be greatly appreciated if you liked 'The Kingdom at the End of the Driveway' fanpage on Facebook. www.facebook.com/krakenbooks

Also, please follow me on Twitter @krakenbooks or https://twitter.com/KrakenBooks

If you'd like to check out more on 'The Kingdom at the End of the Driveway' series, please visit the official site, www.krakenbooks.com

Thanks and I appreciate all of your support!

~ Jefferson Knapp

story:
Hi Friends and Family

I have volunteered to serve as an alumnae sponsor for the student-run travel club at my high school alma mater, the Philadelphia High School for Girls ("Girls' High).

For most of the students, it is their first experience abroad.  In the midst of their excitement, they have questions. What do I pack? How do I travel with my passport? Will my body wash spill in my suitcase? As exciting as the first overseas trip can be, it can  also be daunting and nerve wracking.

With your donation, we will be able to provide the students the proper travel items they need for the trip.  Saving them from the frustrations of TSA and avoiding an inevitable spill of lotions and personal items in their luggage. My hope is with this trip, the students will build the confidence to continue travleing abroad.

I attribute my career and my own experiences abroad to my first trip with Girls High. I hope that you can contribute to this cause. 

If there are any questions, send me an email at ast242@gmail.com and I will be happy to discuss further.

Please feel free to pass this along to other people that would donate to this cause.

story:
Mission:

To increase opportunities for youth of lesser economic circumstances in Philadelphia by offering a safe place for physical activity and personal growth through the traditional Chung Do Kwan style of Tae Kwon Do at little or no cost.

What We Need:

To get YMAP up and running we need to fund the following:

  • Martial Arts Insurance
  • Uniforms and equipment
  • IRS 501(c)3 paper work
  • Rent

The Impact:

Not only can martial arts provide a space for physical activity but als an avenue to each life skills and self-esteem.

    • Physical Activity
      • Burns on average of 752 calories per hour
      • Increase flexibility
      • Increase balance

    • Life Skills
      • Focus
      • Discipline
      • Goal setting
      • Respect
      • Self-regulation
      • Self-esteem

Other Ways You Can Help:

As a start up non-profit we can always help:

  • Volunteer your skills and service - 
    • For Example: Business, martial arts skill and want to host a workshop
  • Live in the area and want to help teach class
  • Believe in the cause and want to serve on the board

If you want to get involved YMAP email steph@youthmartialartsphilly.org
